  freestar.config = freestar.config || {};

        <div class="grid-container" id="main-content">
                            <div class="grid-x grid-margin-x">
    <div class="small-12 medium-12 large-9 cell">

        <div class="grid-x bg-white grid-padding-x grid-padding-y" style="width: 100%; position: relative;" itemtype="http://schema.org/Product" itemscope><div class="cell small-12" id="toptop"><h1 </a></div><div style="clear:both;"></div></div><div><sup>Sponsored</sup></div></div><div class="cell show-for-medium medium-6" style="padding: 0.6rem;"><!-- Tag ID: fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_1 -->
<div class="freeStarFragrantica" align="center" data-freestar-ad="__300x300" id="fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_1" v-pre>
</div></div></div><div class="grid-x grid-margin-x grid-margin-y"><div class="cell small-6"><likes-rating :perfume_id="57513" chart="show" type-chart="small-chart" colors="retro"></likes-rating></div><div class="cell small-6"><seasons-rating :perfume_id="57513" chart="show" type-chart="small-chart" colors="retro"></seasons-rating></div><div class="small-12 medium-6 text-center" style="max-height: 50px"><div itemprop="aggregateRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/AggregateRating" itemscope><p class="info-note">Perfume rating&nbsp;<span itemprop="ratingValue">3.78</span>&nbsp;out of&nbsp;<span itemprop="bestRating">5</span> with&nbsp;<span itemprop="ratingCount" content="1250">1,250</span> votes<meta itemprop="reviewCount" content="218"/></p></div></div></div><div class="grid-x grid-margin-x grid-margin-y"><div class="cell small-12" itemprop="description" v-pre><p><b>Baie 19</b> by <b>Le Labo</b> is a Aromatic Green fragrance for women and men. <b>Baie 19</b> was launched in 2019. </p><div v-pre class='fragrantica-blockquote'><p>"Truth isBaie 19 should have been called Water 19. Not that it smells like nothing (though nothing smells like it), but it has this crisp, wet, drenched effect that water gives to the earth after the rain... And theres a word for that, by the way: petrichor. Its that magical feeling during heavy rain after a long dry spell, and its one of the most beautiful olfactive phenomena in nature."</p>

<p>Notes: dry juniper berry, patchouli, green leaves, ambroxan, musk... all soaked by a beautiful, luminous, magnetic rain after a long drought.</p>

                            <div class="num-votes-sp"><span style="font-size: 0.8rem;">9</span></div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="vote-box-sp-ai">
                             <span>
                            <i class="far fa-thumbs-down"></i>
                             </span>
                            <div class="num-votes-sp"><span style="font-size: 0.8rem;">11</span></div>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                    </div>
                    No warming or uplifting notes
                </div>
                            <div class="cell small-12" style="display: inline-flex; margin: 0.4rem;word-wrap: break-word;padding: 0 0.6rem 0 0.6rem;">
                    <div class="fa-lg" style="display: flex; align-items: center; color: grey; cursor: pointer;">
                    <div style="display: inline-flex;">
                        <div class="vote-box-sp-ai">
                            <span>
                            <i class="far fa-thumbs-up"></i>
                                 </span>
                            <div class="num-votes-sp"><span style="font-size: 0.8rem;">7</span></div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="vote-box-sp-ai">
                             <span>
                            <i class="far fa-thumbs-down"></i>
                             </span>
                            <div class="num-votes-sp"><span style="font-size: 0.8rem;">17</span></div>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                    </div>
                    Patchouli/ambroxan bomb in the opening
                </div>
                    </div>
    </div>

<div class="freeStarFragrantica" align="center" data-freestar-ad="__300x300" id="fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_5" v-pre>
</div></div><div class="cell small-12"><ul class="tabs" data-deep-link="true" data-update-history="true" data-deep-link-smudge="true" data-deep-link-smudge-delay="500" data-tabs id="deeplinked-tabs"><li class="tabs-title is-active"><a href="#all-reviews" aria-selected="true"><svg class="menu" style="width: 1rem; height: 1rem;display: inline-block" fill="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 20 20" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M10 18a8 8 0 100-16 8 8 0 000 16zm1-12a1 1 0 10-2 0v4a1 1 0 00.293.707l2.828 2.829a1 1 0 101.415-1.415L11 9.586V6z"clip-rule="evenodd"></path></svg>All reviews by date</a></li><li class="tabs-title"><a href="#popular-positive-reviews"><svg class="menu hide-for-medium" style="width: 1rem; height: 1rem;display: inline-block" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 24 24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-width="2" d="M7 8h10M7 12h4m1 8l-4-4H5a2 2 0 01-2-2V6a2 2 0 012-2h14a2 2 0 012 2v8a2 2 0 01-2 2h-3l-4 4z"></path></svg><like style="width: 1rem; height: 1rem;"></like><span class="show-for-medium">Positive Reviews</span></a></li><li class="tabs-title"><a href="#popular-negative-reviews"><svg class="menu hide-for-medium" style="width: 1rem; height: 1rem;display: inline-block" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 24 24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-width="2" d="M7 8h10M7 12h4m1 8l-4-4H5a2 2 0 01-2-2V6a2 2 0 012-2h14a2 2 0 012 2v8a2 2 0 01-2 2h-3l-4 4z"></path></svg><dislike style="width: 1rem; height: 1rem;"></dislike><span class="show-for-medium">Negative Reviews</span></a></li><li class="tabs-title"><a href="#search-reviews"><svg class="menu hide-for-medium" style="width: 1rem; height: 1rem;display: inline-block" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 24 24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-width="2" d="M7 8h10M7 12h4m1 8l-4-4H5a2 2 0 01-2-2V6a2 2 0 012-2h14a2 2 0 012 2v8a2 2 0 01-2 2h-3l-4 4z"></path></svg><i class="fas fa-search"></i><span class="show-for-medium">Search</span></a></li></ul><reviews-wrapper><div class="tabs-content" data-tabs-content="deeplinked-tabs"><div class="tabs-panel is-active" id="all-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>All Reviews By Date</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
        <div class="cell destinationreview"></div>                    <div id="parent2371249" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2371249" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Maegangill"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2262217"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Maegangill" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2371249ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2371249" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2262217">Maegangill</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-12-04"></span><fromunixtime unixtime="1733371944" class="vote-button-legend"></fromunixtime></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is my ALL TIME favorite scent - refreshing, but earthy, petrichor and patchouli. It is truly signature-scent-worthy. When I first spray this, Im eight years old again, playing outside in the rain in my Pittsburgh childhood home driveway - a perfect juxtaposition of the raindrops on my face and the asphalt still warm under my bare feet.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2371249"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2371249#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2340356" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2340356" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Fiona Juniper"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1421457"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1421457.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Fiona Juniper" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Paris-Corner/Khair-Pistachio-92766.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.92766.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Khair Pistachio"title="Khair Pistachio"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2340356ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2340356" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1421457">Fiona Juniper</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-11-06">11/06/24 19:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Amongst all the 4 fragrances ive tried smelling at a Le Lebo store this one might be a little better than the other 3. I did not read the notes beforehand but I think I liked it because of the juniper berries. Nonetheless its okay but I wouldnt buy it. To my nose, its cold and it smells a bit like opening a refrigerator and it also smells quite a bit like it. Baie 19 and FM Leau dhiver has that cold, light, crisp smell upon initial spray. <br />
<br />
For what it is, the pricing is a bit steep which is common for Le Labo fragrances. This is not a safe blind buy.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2340356"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2340356#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2327899" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2327899" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jgusov1"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2294487"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2294487.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jgusov1" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2327899ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2327899" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2294487">jgusov1</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-25">10/25/24 23:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells like how you might perceive the smell of drying off after a swim in a freshwater lake up in Maine or New Hampshire. Super unique scent, and it smells familiar while still being sort of like something I'd never smelled before. Overall, super cool fragrance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2327899"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2327899#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2322592" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2322592" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="NewbyNB"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2243463"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="NewbyNB" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2322592ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2322592" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2243463">NewbyNB</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-21">10/21/24 05:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Not sure if I have a bad sample or am just getting the notes differently from everyone else, but I get a PUNCH of a juniper note in the beginning, which lasts for at least an hour (when I'm writing this). <br />
<br />
I don't really get the ozonic notes (though to be fair it rained last night). It's just not giving me petrichor or forest - which maybe makes sense since I live in the UK and juniper berries mostly grow in the US and patchouli grows in India and other parts of Asia. <br />
<br />
Not super musky though there is a hint there. <br />
<br />
Honestly, I'm just super mad about the whole experience - juniper berries is in the name and barely anyone is mentioning it? Also the description being all about water just feels like someone is describing an entirely different fragrance. And I'm not getting the menthol/medicinal quality others are getting. I'm just so confused and annoyed!<br />
<br />
If I happen across a Le Labo counter somewhere, I'll give it another go, but wow I hated everything about this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2322592"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2322592#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2310220" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2310220" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="barcelonaboi10"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2015714"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2015714.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="barcelonaboi10" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jorum-Studio/Paradisi-73093.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.73093.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Paradisi"title="Paradisi"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2310220ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2310220" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2015714">barcelonaboi10</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-09">10/09/24 12:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This isn't for me, but I think the petrichor note is really well done. Ultimately, the scent is too deep and earthy for my personal tastes, but there are lighter counterbalanced notes like juniper too. I probably have to admit I'm just not a patchouli fan and move on. Echoing what others have said about this: it has a wet and outdoorsy quality to it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2310220"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2310220#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71); padding: 0; border: none; margin: 0;"><!-- Tag ID: fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_6 -->
<div class="freeStarFragrantica" align="center" data-freestar-ad="__300x300" id="fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_6" v-pre>
</div></div><div id="parent2308104" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2308104" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="toldo1959"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2209346"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="toldo1959" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2308104ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2308104" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2209346">toldo1959</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-07">10/07/24 14:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This one is a winner for me.  We have an old lakeside cottage in Northern Minnesota.  This instantly transports me there.  It reminds me of the smell after a good thunderstorm goes through and the forest floor and leaves are breathing.  You can smell the lake.  Its lovely.  This is pretty close on my skin but I get good longevity.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2308104"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2308104#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2302603" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2302603" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Angelsbreathxyz"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2255859"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Angelsbreathxyz" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2302603ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2302603" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2255859">Angelsbreathxyz</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-02">10/02/24 11:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Havent really let the perfume develop so will probably have to do another in depth review later. Its not my style however, it is a nice scent, it sits fairly close to the skin, it is also quite inoffensive and musky, like a clean green fragrance with an almost minty freshness to it but not harsh mint but a sweet creamy one. The patchouli is quite prominent and really pushes through at the beginning and I think it should be listed as a top and middle since it maintains that strength throughout. Its well formulated and I can see why some may gravitate towards this but again, its not my cup of tea . Deffo not blind buy safe and not worth the price point. Be sure to sample before committing to a full bottle!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2302603"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2302603#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2292407" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2280593"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2280593#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2274244" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2274244" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="klonopinbrat"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1454273"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1454273.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="klonopinbrat" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2274244ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2274244" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1454273">klonopinbrat</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-06">09/06/24 22:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>One of my favorites from Le Labo. The petrichor is deep and well rounded. A very obviously wet earth forward scent. To my endless amusement, it has essentially the exact same scent as that of an old musty battleship. Cold, metallic, and obviously very wet at some point in time. Unexpected &amp; gorgeous. It's so specific. The first notes hit and then BAM instant recall to the many battleships &amp; old war museums I was made to tour in my youth. But apparently this was not a universal experience. So, IYKYK. <br />
<br />
Love to layer this scent with The Noir 29 for some biting intensity !</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2274244"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2274244#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2261661" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2261661" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ajlis"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2074474"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2074474.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ajlis" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/The-Noir-29-31872.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31872.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Noir 29"title="The Noir 29"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2261661ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2261661" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2074474">Ajlis</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-26">08/26/24 12:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Baie 19 succeeds where Demeter's Thunderstorm and many other perfumes fail: it captures the smell after rain. Its not rain in the city with wet asphalt and concrete buildings, but rather rain in the woods  damp soil and wet rocks. The patchouli and geosmin notes are strong, and I would describe this perfume earthy more than airy. It is very aquatic which may be why it reminds me a little bit of a mens aftershave  but in the best, most high-quality way possible. Baie 19 can be perceived as somewhat masculine but to me its perfectly unisex. Its cool, wild and outdoorsy, and I would love to wear it on a rainy day.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2261661"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2261661#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2255626" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2255626" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Homebird"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2109909"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2109909.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Homebird" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Bubble-Bath-60105.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.60105.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bubble Bath"title="Bubble Bath"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2255626ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2255626" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2109909">Homebird</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-20">08/20/24 17:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I can appreciate the attempt on creating a petrichor fragrance but they failed somehow, although I wonder if their patchouli wasn't so medicinal or the juniper berries so sour it could have worked, I don't know. <br />
it is still a good and unique smell tho, if you are a big patchouli fan like me, I'm sure you'll like it but if you are expecting a rainy concrete soil then this isn't it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2255626"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2255626#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2255410" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2255410" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mscholl923"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1544224"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1544224.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mscholl923" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2255410ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2255410" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1544224">mscholl923</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-20">08/20/24 12:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Abstract and unique -- smells like a very expensive hotel soap (in the best way). Clean, but not at all too sharp or fresh; mossy, woody, very earthy. A nice hint of musk. Elegant. I don't really smell too much of that rain-on-concrete, to be honest. Smells like an old, damp violin, as somebody else on here said. A really great earthy scent for warm climates -- refreshing but not at all cloying.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2255410"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2255410#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2248815" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Not for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2248815"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2248815#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2238388" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Fake, artificial smelling, cold, no depth and quite strong. Masculine, and yes, I get the Vick vapour rub comments too. All in all it reminds me of a general male shower or shaving gel smell.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2238388"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2238388#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2236865" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1309936">IamdrinkingBeer</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-01">08/01/24 13:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>@perfumedboyfriend: Baie 19 is named after a note...berry...as in juniper berry...which is clearly in the note lineup...</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2235959"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2235959#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2235950" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2235950" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="perfumedboyfriend"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2140820"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2140820.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="perfumedboyfriend" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Clue-Perfumery/Warm-Bulb-88207.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.88207.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Warm Bulb"title="Warm Bulb"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2235950ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2235950" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2140820">perfumedboyfriend</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-01">08/01/24 13:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Aside from the ones named for specific collaborators (Another 13, the Colette ones), this is the only Le Labo fragrance I know of that isnt named for an ingredient, which makes sense given how abstract it feelsto me, anyway. Baie 19 implies a bay of water, and it does make me think of the still, reflective surface of a cold mountain lake, with rocky, mossy shores under a silver sky. Rather than the moist earth of petrichor, it calls up damp stones. I get mineral, medicinal juniper and a combination of metallic, ozonic, herbal, green, and synthetic, almost latex-ish notes, and then some earthy musk as it settles down. Its the natural world in vivid detail, but as if you were seeing it in VR, or a dream. Its disorienting and magnetic, very subtle but continuously surprisingWhat am I smelling? I keep asking myself. I imagine this being what a mirror would smell like if it had a smellthe scent seems to arrive in my nose as if it was getting refracted through a lens, bent or inverted, like rays of light. Unlike a lot of other molecular-type skin scents, this one also lasts, though it doesnt really project. Im deeply intrigued by it. Maybe my favourite Le Labo fragrance? Certainly one of their weirdest. Expensive, of course, and it also suggests a mood I might only occasionally want to inhabit, so not an easy purchase. <br />
<br />
Incidentally, the first time I tried this, I also sampled Aesops Eremia, Tacit, and Ouranon, which I think aim for similar territory: understated, meditative, herbal, earthy, abstractedand overpriced. Those three are all interesting and cool in their own ways, but if I was going to spend over $200 on 50ml, I think Baie 19 delivers more.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2235950"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2235950#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2235468" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2235468" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Presentscents"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1621761"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1621761.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Presentscents" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Tempo-Eau-de-Parfum-48680.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48680.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tempo Eau de Parfum"title="Tempo Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2235468ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2235468" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1621761">Presentscents</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-01">08/01/24 04:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Weird, starts out as kind of a latex sandlewood rubber accord kind of in the same style as Seminalis. About 10 minutes after then it completely changes direction into this designer-aquatic stone type of accord.( I find this pleasant .) finally about 30 mins later it settles into a really nice lightly aquatic/floral - damp- woodsy  accord. I think its quite nice actually and I could see myself wearing this a some type of skin scent. Only problem is price tag.  $200+ for a fragrance this minimal,  smh.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2235468"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2235468#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2226637" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2226637" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="austinmdpedi"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2073655"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2073655.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="austinmdpedi" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2226637ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2226637" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2073655">austinmdpedi</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-22">07/22/24 22:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Diary notes for 10ml decant:<br />
<br />
1* premier: Struggling to understand this one. I get a bit of a metallic note. Rubber bandaid. Hint of juniper. Mint. 20 min in okay there is the funky stuff. <br />
<br />
Second wear. Okay. I get some rain on concrete. But its overwhelmed by benzoin and bandaid. Ends with an earthy funk. <br />
<br />
(A month later)<br />
<br />
Why do I think about this fragrance so much if I put it in the not for me drawer?<br />
<br />
Another go. <br />
<br />
Juniper. Rain. Funk. Remains with that odd medicinal note + bandaid. Weirdly and completely addictive. Constantly smelling my wrist. No idea how it smells to others. Im getting 4-6 projection and 10+ total length. <br />
<br />
(Puts on FB buy list).</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2226637"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2226637#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2212658" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2212658" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="IamdrinkingBeer"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1309936"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1309936.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="IamdrinkingBeer" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/Fleur-d-Oranger-27-6331.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6331.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fleur d'Oranger 27"title="Fleur d'Oranger 27"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2212658ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2212658" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1309936">IamdrinkingBeer</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-09">07/09/24 01:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells like a raindrop on a green leaf after a june rain...beautiful, just beautiful, almost poetic. It reminds me a little of Gaiac 10, but this is more vibrant and fun to wear. I would say this is a new Le Labo classic, right in the line with Musc 25 and Santal 33.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2212658"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2212658#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2210593" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2210593" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="kaleo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1951650"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="kaleo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2210593ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2210593" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1951650">kaleo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-06">07/06/24 23:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>love this so much, starting to become one of my personal favorites out of all the fragrances le labo has. it had to grow on me at first though, i had sprayed it on a strip and it had smelt very strongly and almost pungent of patchouli which turned me off a lot. but i was really trying hard to find that petrichor quality that this scent is supposed to have so i bought a sample, sprayed on skin and let it sit for a little. and holy crap did it turn out sooooo much better. the drydown turns the herby patchouli medicinal smell to a calm, musky, aromatic, mossy and earthy perfection. i'm not sure if it was just my skin but it performed beautifully, and the ambroxan giving it a delicate faint sweetness topped everything off. while i wouldn't necessarily say that this fragrance accurately embodies petrichor and that "fresh rain" persona, it still withholds those traits of an ozonic, green, slightly aquatic earthy scent. the scent is somewhat light and intimate yet noticeable, in the way that if i had smelt this on someone else before while hugging them it would be hard for me to let go. the more time passes by the more i seem to love it. i see a full bottle of this for myself in the springtime</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2210593"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2210593#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2208377" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2208377" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lyssiboo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2171443"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2171443.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lyssiboo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Escentric-Molecules/Molecule-01-845.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.845.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Molecule 01"title="Molecule 01"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2208377ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2208377" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8); Its has a very medicinal/herbal smell to it. O can definitely smell the dampness to it. This also reminds me of when you walk into those stores that sell a lot of herbs. I like it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2208377"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2208377#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2195414" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; I think its the patchouli that Le Labo uses that turns me off.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2195414"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2195414#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2186255" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2186255" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="IlluminatedMinerval"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1765130"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1765130.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="IlluminatedMinerval" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Montale/Vetiver-Patchouli-54890.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.54890.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vetiver Patchouli"title="Vetiver Patchouli"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2186255ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2186255" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1765130">IlluminatedMinerval</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-12">06/12/24 13:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p><br />
Very unique fragrance! It seems that it is supposed to evoke the scent that rain creates when it falls on the soil, but it is not. Lots of ozonic notes on a base of musk and cashmeran. It sometimes reminds me of Molecule 5.<br />
A special choice for any style in any season!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2186255"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2186255#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2180933" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2180933" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ikerus"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1810799"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1810799.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ikerus" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/By-Kilian/Old-Fashioned-96096.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.96096.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Old Fashioned"title="Old Fashioned"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2180933ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2180933" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1810799">Ikerus</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-07">06/07/24 06:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Holy patchouli! That opening is so medicinal but settles nicely into an aromatic aquatic scent about 30 minutes upon first spray. I'm here to tell you that this is not really a petrichor scent. It does smell wet. Mossy even, but not petrichor. I'd say it reminds me of a wet, mossy rock by the ocean. I guess it does live up to its name. <br />
<br />
Also, this may be oddly specific, but Baie 19 smells almost identical to the Bath &amp; Body Works home scent "Frozen Lake." I happened to have a room spray of Frozen Lake at the same time I tested Baie, and the similarity was uncanny.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2180933"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2180933#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2174122" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2174122" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="smellad"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2076842"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2076842.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="smellad" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Delina-43871.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.43871.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Delina"title="Delina"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2174122ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2174122" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2076842">smellad</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-31">05/31/24 22:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very medicinal - Vicky Vaporub smell at first. 30 minutes later, it turns into a very mysterious intriguing fragrance. I am not sure I like enough to buy one but at the same time, I want to have it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2174122"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2174122#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2172410" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
