If this had a better performance, it would probably be my favorite scent of all time.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2172410"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2172410#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2160635" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2160635" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Katie24collins"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1849993"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Katie24collins" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2160635ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2160635" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1849993">Katie24collins</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-18">05/18/24 21:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>At first blast you get strong patchouli but a few minutes later you get this earthy ozonic scent that smells like you just came inside from a rainstorm. My boyfriend also says it smells good and smells like rain.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2160635"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2160635#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2160116" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2160116" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="raidiological"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1242256"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1242256.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="raidiological" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2160116ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2160116" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1242256">raidiological</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-18">05/18/24 11:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>There's this one time when I was a junior high schooler, our class went to a outdoor trip and all of a sudden the rain fell heavily with a thunder. We ran chaotically to the bus as there's no other buildings there and the bus was parked quite far from the main spot, which left us sat in the cold ass bus with our clothes all drenched in rain.<br />
<br />
Baie 19 *magically* evokes that very particular memories that I forgot for years. The earthy &amp; ozonic wet soil, fresh rain water, the dusty bus seats I was about to sell this one as I dont like patchouli that much, but I ended up keeping it as I appreciate it more now.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2160116"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2160116#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2146006" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2146006" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="aaronburrkowitz"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1914361"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1914361.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="aaronburrkowitz" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2146006ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2146006" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1914361">aaronburrkowitz</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-04">05/04/24 20:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Like if someone slathered Vicks VapoRub all over a wet, mossy forest. Sure, it smells vaguely of petrichor, but that pleasant smell only crops up, like, 30 minutes after the initial application, and then wears off well before the Vicks does. Then, I guess, you just walk around smelling like you're congested for the rest of the day. Great job!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2146006"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2146006#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2141006" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2141006" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="yuushinron666"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2052083"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2052083.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="yuushinron666" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Sartorial-10559.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.10559.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sartorial"title="Sartorial"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2141006ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2141006" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2052083">yuushinron666</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-30">04/30/24 07:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>At first I was very interested in this scent. Spraying on perfume that reminds me of the smell after the rain should remind me of the days when the earthy scent of the rain fell. The green scent from the succulent trees I expected that (too much). I was disappointed with Baie 19. I only smelled patchouli, a woody scent, and it developed into a patchouli-like cheap inhalant scent that's common in Thailand. I hate the strong patchouli smell in inhalers, and yes I hate this one. What does this have to do with the smell of rain?</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2141006"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2141006#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2130530" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2130530" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Leesome"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1382928"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Leesome" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2130530ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2130530" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1382928">Leesome</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-20">04/20/24 09:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I am so glad I gave this a chance and let it sit after the first spray, as it can be sharp and medicinal at first.  But it becomes a warm, earthy patchouli that's done the way I like it. I do not get an ounce of petrichor or wet soil, but that's fine by me, as I am not a fan of those notes.  Very comforting, but still unusual. Can be worn daily. Also, as a city dweller who smells Santal 33 on everyone, I never smell anyone wearing Baie, so it still feels like a little secret to me. This is my favorite Le Labo scent, and I know they are overpriced or whatever, but their scents are top quality and I appreciate that they offer a smaller sized bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2130530"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2130530#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2129294" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2129294" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="OrangeSprout"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2085363"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="OrangeSprout" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Ralph-Lauren/Polo-Blue-1198.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1198.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Polo Blue"title="Polo Blue"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2129294ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2129294" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89); align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2129294"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2129294#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2121702" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2121702" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jkwon117"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1880595"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1880595.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jkwon117" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2121702ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2121702" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1880595">jkwon117</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-11">04/11/24 14:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The opening was not my cup of tea...reminded me a bit of the cat litter box, if you know what i mean. <br />
<br />
But that opening faded pretty quickly on my skin. What is left on my skin after 2hrs of wear is damp, smooth, rocks. I wouldn't describe this scent to be ozonic. This scent reminds me of grey clouds filled with rain that hangs close to the ground. It doesn't smell like how earth smells after the rain, but rather before a sudden downpour. It evokes the feeling of anticipation. <br />
<br />
longevity is good, leans masculine, and season-less.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2121702"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2121702#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2119988" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Get your nose on it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2119988"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2119988#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2115796" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1867139">jpazvalbuena</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-01">04/01/24 03:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>My nose is definitely broken  or my decant is from the wrong fragrance. Super strong patchouli that reminds me quite a bit of Incident Diplomatique. At some point in the early opening I thought maybe I had sprayed ACDDM by mistake. Really weird. Not a bad scent, but by no means the type of scent that I had imagined from the reviews<br />
<br />
EDIT after an hour: the dry-down becomes a much smoother, softer patchouli that I think fits better with my expectations. Definitely worth a try</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2110489"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2110489#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2109305" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1555935">astralmonad870</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-30">03/30/24 19:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I absolutely detest when patchouli is used as a base note in fruity floral perfumes like Chanel but I love it when the perfume centers on patchouli as it does here. This is very tranquil and calming. Perfume Parlour UK does good dupes of a lot of Le Labo perfumes and they ship worldwide. Try them!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2109305"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2109305#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2097226" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2097226" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Johnny Madison"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1889501"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1889501.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Johnny Madison" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Andrea-Maack/Soft-Tension-39036.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.39036.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Soft Tension"title="Soft Tension"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2097226ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2097226" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1889501">Johnny Madison</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-19">03/19/24 07:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I am not the biggest fan of pachouli, but this is done so right here. I have never experienced a fragrance that captures rain and water like this one does. This is the first fragrance to transport me to a place I have longed to revisit: a marina in Barcelona, the wind blowing from the Irish sea on a blustery afternoon in Ireland, coming out of the Mediterranean Sea on a warm afternoon, a breeze coming through the window of a cabin in Geirangerfjord... a waterfall, a stream, a river...It somehow captures all forms of water, the deep sea, the rain that lingers on the cobble stone streets of a seaside village. What an experience. A masterpiece!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2097226"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2097226#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2094905" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2094905" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="silvakuro"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1866093"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1866093.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="silvakuro" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2094905ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2094905" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1866093">silvakuro</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-16">03/16/24 20:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This perfume is an intriguing experience, the first for its kind that I tried! <br />
<br />
I'm not getting much of the petrichor and on my skin, I'm getting more of the ozonic notes and the musk, which is a surprisingly pleasant combination. Only a bit later I'm getting the patchouli and the green notes. The scent is almost nostalgic.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2094905"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2094905#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2088908" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2088908" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="RGH01"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1331188"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1331188.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="RGH01" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Francesca-Bianchi/The-Dark-Side-40884.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.40884.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Dark Side"title="The Dark Side"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2088908ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2088908" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1331188">RGH01</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-11">03/11/24 06:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Baie 19 is an ozonic woody patchouli which celebrates the juxtaposition of dark and rich earthy notes with bright and sparkly refreshing notes. Its not a particularly complex scent and it does come across rather synthetic, but I like it.<br />
<br />
The deep, earthy nature of green patchouli takes centre stage with this scent, reminiscent of the damp forest floor. To contrast this, vague ozonic accords brighten the air around you to lift and freshen up the scent profile, elevated by the clean juiciness of juniper. This is all then carried and boosted by a hefty dose of ambroxan too. <br />
<br />
This is a fairly simplistic yet effective clean masculine scent profile. Its not particularly unique or memorable, but it does smell damn good in the moment. I wouldnt buy a bottle for myself but I can see why people enjoy this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2088908"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2088908#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2084516" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2084516" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="TheFinalPurl"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1941309"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1941309.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="TheFinalPurl" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Atelier-Materi/Cedre-Figalia-90800.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.90800.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Cdre Figalia"title="Cdre Figalia"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2084516ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2084516" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1941309">TheFinalPurl</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-06">03/06/24 16:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Definitely getting the rain, maybe the ocean. Now that I see the notes patchouli does make sense. But, it smells cleaner than what I would expect looking at the notes. Interesting!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2084516"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2084516#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2073146" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2073146" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="7TS"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2031593"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2031593.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="7TS" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2073146ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2073146" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2031593">7TS</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-24">02/24/24 19:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>To me its smells like dried fig. It IS a very attractive perfume, longevity is at its best, but to me this is nowhere near OZONIC or GREEN. I find it histerical that Le Labo website says: BAIE 19 should have been called Water 19. Thus fragrance is NOTHING like WATER!!! It is the total opposite! Very ambery, very heavy smells just like dried fruit and a bit like vintage wooden cabinets  should be called Anjeer 19. <br />
<br />
I do love it. It is my favorite from Le Labo but not fresh, not green, not ozonic</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2073146"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2073146#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2072145" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2072145" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="blushings"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1775600"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1775600.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="blushings" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Poesie/Oyster-54227.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.54227.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Oyster!"title="Oyster!"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2072145ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2072145" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1775600">blushings</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-23">02/23/24 20:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I get ozone, raspberries, aloe, and something flammable but not alcoholic, like propane. I think patchouli is there but it's been sterilized. The image I get is a Gap commercial from the 90s that's trying to evoke the 70s. Synthetic youth.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2072145"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2072145#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2063295" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2063295" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="smellimelk"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1882773"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1882773.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="smellimelk" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2063295ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2063295" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1882773">smellimelk</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-15">02/15/24 12:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>before we got to ozonic, green pleasantries, there was the sting of dry gin that makes you wince and a good 20 minutes of it smelling like my graphite laden putty eraser from college.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2063295"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2063295#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2052233" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2052233" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Zig von Katz"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2001841"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2001841.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Zig von Katz" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2052233ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2052233" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2001841">Zig von Katz</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-04">02/04/24 15:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a wonderful scent for the spring time, but it dies out pretty quickly for the price. I didn't get rain or aquatic notes from this, but I LOVE the juniper berry in this!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2052233"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2052233#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2037085" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2037085" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Scratch &amp; Sniff"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1878218"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1878218.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Scratch &amp; Sniff" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2037085ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2037085" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1878218">Scratch &amp; Sniff</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-20">01/20/24 22:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I understand the slight petrichor vibe.  But, at the same time, theres also something slightly funky happening behind the scenes with Baie 19, and I cant quite put my finger or my nose on what that is.<br />
<br />
The fragrance opens with that patchouli-influenced petrichor, and it closes the dry-down with a scent that's best described as an Ivory bar of soap-on-a-rope dragged through wet soil.  None of this is unpleasant, yet not full-bottle worthy, either.<br />
<br />
Baie 19 is self-contradictory and a paradox.  Theres a wetness to this fragrance, but it certainly isnt aquatic by any means.  Nor is it true petrichor.  It reminds me of the rainy woods behind my familys lake cottage during dark and thundering summer afternoons, but not enough for this scent to be nostalgic.  I like it, but I dont.  Its unique, but ultimately forgettable.  Its intriguing, but not enough to purchase.<br />
<br />
In five words or less: Meh.  Bye, bye, Baie.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2037085"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2037085#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2032251" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2032251" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="alternateu"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/557327"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="alternateu" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2032251ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2032251" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/557327">alternateu</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-16">01/16/24 01:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Not petrichor at all to me. Very ozonic, metallic and sharp (agree with @Wristsniffer) and like the reviewer before me, I get tobacco as well. This perfume kind of smells like the colours grey and green, mixed together and then dragged down into the dirt. <br />
If I squint, I can imagine it as maybe a hippie spa-room type scent... but that's about it.<br />
I was sold on the reviewers on YouTube talking about how this smelled like a refined man, classy, gentle, soft... nothing like that to me - this was like an assault on the senses. Thankfully I only bought a decant.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2032251"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2032251#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2030522" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2030522" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="smelling.sniffing.swan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1892188"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1892188.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="smelling.sniffing.swan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2030522ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2030522" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1892188">smelling.sniffing.swan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-14">01/14/24 06:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Heavy on the ambroxan in this one.<br />
<br />
I don't get as much greenery as others seem to, but definitely plenty of damp earth.<br />
I had to double check that I had actually sprayed Baie 19, because my experience of this seems to differ a lot to other reviews.<br />
<br />
I get a quite prominent leathery note and some woody tobacco, maybe pyralone?<br />
Some burnt rubber for sure.<br />
Also quite resinous, not dissimilar to Hermes Agar Ebene.<br />
<br />
VERDICT: Not a bad scent, but not my style. Pretty bottom-heavy. Le Labo's horrific pricing bring this down to a meh.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2030522"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2030522#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2007791" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2007791" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Esna"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/130358"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.130358.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="Esna" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Headspace/Kirsch-Headspace-86159.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.86159.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Kirsch Headspace"title="Kirsch Headspace"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2007791ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2007791" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/130358">Esna</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-22">12/22/23 05:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Cloudy day in the Fort Davis mountains. 50 shades of grey colored mountains camouflaged with grey low clouds. Bring out a country basket full of berries and sugar cubes to place on a picnic table made from a natural rock formation slab from the surrounding area and wood benches. Not done setting the picnic when you have to run back to the car due to sudden rain. Heady make out session while we wait. We checkout the aftermath of the mini thunderstorm; pretichor with dissolved sugar and damp berries. </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2007791"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2007791#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2000478" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2000478" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="dsgnmind"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1480012"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1480012.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="dsgnmind" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2000478ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2000478" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1480012">dsgnmind</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-13">12/13/23 14:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Initial opening and dry down morph broadly for me. At first I get most of the notes: bright, green, with patchouli swirling. Later in the day I get the darker wood tones with a pine-like greeness still echoing but clearly taking a back seat. I like it more on me than by itself. While it's blending well with me and it's nice, I find it a hint too clean and (I hate to say it) fresh pine soapy. It's a bit too friendly for me, while it's price point isn't friendly at all.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="2000478"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=2000478#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1999646" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1236913">naxcissique</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-11">12/11/23 03:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I used to think I hate petrichor, and that I would hate this scent. But the smell is more like clean spring water running over mossy rocks. I loved layering this with Another 13 because its ozonic scent, coupled with the muskiness of Another 13, just makes me feel incredibly sophisticated. This is not the best Le Labo for me (that goes to Another 13), but now that Ive finished my bottle I find that I miss it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1998227"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1998227#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1996488" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1996488" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="flyingfish"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/300086"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="flyingfish" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Dior-Addict-Eau-Fraiche-2014-25611.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.25611.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Dior Addict Eau Fraiche 2014"title="Dior Addict Eau Fraiche 2014"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1996488ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1996488" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/300086">flyingfish</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-08">12/08/23 23:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I just love this. The musk and patchouli are definitely noticeable. I can't smell the petrichor though. There is a slight burnt rubber smell somewhere, but it doesn't ruin the fragrance for me. I find it so appealing, and truly a unisex perfume. I can smell traces of soap, sweetness, and the DNA of SJP Lovely/Narciso Rodriguez For Her. It smells very clean to me despite the presence of patchouli. I just love this so much that I had to get a full bottle. Just like all the Le Labo fragrances, it is overpriced.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1996488"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1996488#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1995336" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Gnarly.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1977615"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1977615#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1974070" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1974070" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="astralmonad870"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1555935"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1555935.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="astralmonad870" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dries-Van-Noten/Jardin-de-L-Orangerie-72594.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.72594.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Jardin de L'Orangerie"title="Jardin de L'Orangerie"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1974070ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1974070" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1555935">astralmonad870</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-11">11/11/23 08:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>People saying this smells like nothing, that is because you are genetically nose-blind to ambroxan. Look it up. Some people cannot smell ambroxan at all. Personally to me this smells beautiful and I love the patchouli note in this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1974070"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1974070#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1965553" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1965553" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Wristsniffer"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/8582"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.8582.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Wristsniffer" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Narciso-Rodriguez/Narciso-Rodriguez-For-Her-209.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.209.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Narciso Rodriguez For Her"title="Narciso Rodriguez For Her"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1965553ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1965553" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/8582">Wristsniffer</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-31">10/31/23 20:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have a set of Le Labo fragrances and this is the one I like least of the six included. I've never been a fan of wet, grassy, leafy scents but this just smells exactly like nail polish and cold metal to my nose, perhaps with a slight undertone of cedar. I've smelled many Le Labo fragrances and adore quite a few of them, and even those I wouldn't wear I've still respected. It's not that I don't respect Baie 19, I just can't understand the appeal, and I don't believe it's the juniper putting me off as I love a good Hendricks and tonic. It was an instant recoil and hard pass for me. Definitely not trying to hate on anyone's favorite scent but rather to warn those who may be interested - please sample before dropping a small fortune on this one. The hyped Le Labos are fantastic to my nose but this one was a metallic, chemical nightmare for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1965553"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1965553#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1953804" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1953804" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Granny Autismo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1678715"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Granny Autismo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Kalan-56036.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.56036.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Kalan"title="Kalan"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1953804ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1953804" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1678715">Granny Autismo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-16">10/16/23 22:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is an amazing petrichor fragrance. I was hoping there would be geosmin in here, but I'm not picking up any on my skin. One thing that I love about this fragrance is how it's smashed and quilted with patchouli. Patchouli is one of my favourite notes, and I especially love how amped up it is on my skin, so given how much patchouli there naturally is in this fragrance, it projects like a beast on me (well almost).</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1953804"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1953804#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1946322" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1946322" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="duckybubs"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1853073"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1853073.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="duckybubs" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/Tabac-28-Miami-54784.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.54784.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tabac 28 Miami"title="Tabac 28 Miami"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1946322ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1946322" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1853073">duckybubs</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-07">10/07/23 09:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Baie 19 is a scent for the quieter, thoughtful person. For me, this reminds me of my teenage years in Tennessee, when the rain would come down in the woods near my houseall the components of the juniper bush come out making this scent smell like you're walking in a path of fog leading to a forest surrounding in colder, wet bark all whilst the earth takes in the rain's moisture afterwards. <br />
<br />
Loved this in more humid climates and spring/summer/fall, but the patchouli+juniper could lean more menthol-y in winter months. A very distinct scent that I don't see a lot of other fragrance houses leaning into!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1946322"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1946322#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1941004" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1901302" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="camphor_lover"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1712486"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1712486.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="camphor_lover" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1901302ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1901302" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.87);
