Water over stone, maybe a little chlorinated, fresh fresh fresh city pumped water.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1901302"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1901302#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1885838" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1885838" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Honey10"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1799473"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Honey10" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1885838ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1885838" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1799473">Honey10</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-24">07/24/23 08:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I absolutely love this smell straight from first spray but only lasts like 30 mins on my skin. I had a crazy idea to layer 2/1 with AG Cloudjust to mix smells I like/ everything but the kitchen sink Mugler Angel style. This concoction drastically improves the sillage for me. Ive never smelled baccarat 540, but from descriptions maybe my potion is similar, but the ambroxen makes it SO interesting. First few minutes is straight strawberry cotton candy, but on dry down almost all the sweet disappears leaving allll the delicious dirty stink so good but still somehow make it CLEAN </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1885838"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1885838#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1877219" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Somewhat harsh and chemically; one friend described it as brisque. I get some petrichor which makes it tolerable and unique, but still very meh. Got very good feedback from another friend though, which is positive.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1877219"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1877219#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1875032" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1614689">DapperDon</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-09">07/09/23 16:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Too sweet for what the fragrance tries to invoke. Like damp patchouli &amp; sugar cubes.<br />
Its a dirty, slutty, skanky sweetness, but definitely does NOT smell like before, during nor after rain fall.<br />
Earthy, woody background. Not ozonic. Not a like nor a hate, I just cant breath in the sweetness all day, its almost cloying.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1875032"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1875032#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1866188" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; The same earthiness, the same greenness/herbaceous hint, with a tiny bit of sweetness; the scent of soil after the rain</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1846622"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1846622#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1842917" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1842917" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LynneFaubert"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1666649"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1666649.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LynneFaubert" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jovoy-Paris/Remember-Me-49435.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.49435.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Remember Me"title="Remember Me"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1842917ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1842917" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1666649">LynneFaubert</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-27">05/27/23 09:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Im retraining my nose after an illness so dont rely on me to give actual notes and such. I will simply say this scent reminds me of sunset at the cottage when flowers exhale their last before the night, the water vapors from the lake hang in the air and the grass becomes bruised under your feet. There are also hints from a campfire barely started, a touch of wood and starter fluid. A hint maybe of the rubber from hot car tires in the distance, unexpected, strange but not unpleasant. Maybe its just me lol. All thats missing is the sunscreen vibe really. Pleasant. I have a sample and Im happy with it though I wont be buying a bottle.<br />
<br />
P.S. Wore this a second time, and changed my mind completely. Wood shavings all the way, like Santal. Body chemistry fluctuates and did this one dirty. Dunno what Le Labo put in their perfume for such a persistent unpleasant-to-me wood note, but Im out</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1842917"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1842917#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1841220" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1841220" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Stoicchild"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1416393"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1416393.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Stoicchild" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jimmy-Choo/Jimmy-Choo-Floral-53143.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.53143.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Jimmy Choo Floral"title="Jimmy Choo Floral"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1841220ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1841220" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1416393">Stoicchild</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-25">05/25/23 01:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>4711 Remix Cologne Festival Vibes 2021 Edition smells like this. That one's unisex too. I've worn both, they're very similar. If you don't like the dry down of this, you might like 4711. It's got more gourmand notes, such as Praline. The Patchouli note doesn't always sit right with everyone. If your skin doesn't absorb Patchouli well, then I wouldn't suggest either. Their longevity could be a factor for some, but they've both lasted the entire day on me </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1841220"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1841220#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1838594" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1838594" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cwavah"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1280569"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1280569.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="cwavah" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1838594ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1838594" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1280569">cwavah</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-21">05/21/23 11:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>getting alot of the greener patchouli.....overall not a very acquatic take to my nose,L'eau d'issey pure issey miyake takes more on acquatics</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1838594"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1838594#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1832497" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1832497" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SmellySal"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1515510"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1515510.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="SmellySal" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1832497ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1832497" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1515510">SmellySal</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-13">05/13/23 21:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Kind of confused by this one. Beautiful, complex opening that smells herbal, dewy, and wet. Reminds me of windswept cyprus trees dripping with salty ocean mist. Occasionally I catch whiffs of beautiful damp potting soil too and it's really nice. Unfortunately the dry down leans laundry detergent isle fresh, which is one of my least favorite scents. For a long while it dabbles back and forth between the two kinds of scents, finally landing on that fresh laundry scent. After several wears I'm still trying to decide if it's a petrichor or a dryer sheet lol. Sprayed it on my wrist before dinner, and could still smell it when I woke up the next day. Those petrichor whiffs are glorious, but I'm not sure about the "fresh" dry down.<br />
<br />
Edit: Absolutely love the opening, but the laundry fresh dry down ruins it for me. To be fair it's like, a really REALLY nice laundry scent, so if the whole "fresh linens" thing is your jam, I'd definitely give this a go. Wouldn't at all mind smelling this on someone else, it's just not for me. Gave my sample to my husband and it smells great on him.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1832497"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1832497#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1827801" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1827801" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Enrium"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/36833"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.36833.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Enrium" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Glossier/You-46885.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.46885.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="You"title="You"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1827801ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1827801" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/36833">Enrium</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-08">05/08/23 10:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Baie 19 is a dewy, sheer green scent that is aquatic in the best sense of the word. Instead of synthetic, watery floral notes, it radiates rainy, petrichor-like dampness, somewhat sap-like and soothing throughout. There is an ozonic quality here that contributes to the rain theme. It also features a creative use of patchouli.<br />
<br />
B19 opens with a slight saltiness, with dewy green notes emerging early. Juniper gives initial bright freshness. It becomes grassy as it develops, still barely-there rather than freshly-mown, but aromatic and green. There is an earthiness that develops, thanks to a perfectly-judged pinch of patchouli, here reminiscent of the ground after recent rain. A clean musky-amber base follows, tying everything together nicely. It fades to a musky, earthy, slightly green skin scent. Sillage is intimate and longevity is moderate.<br />
<br />
The best petrichor scent I've tried yet, B19 is pretty impressive, but not perfect - its performance is lacking considering the price. A unisex spring/summer scent, B19 is clever and well-composed overall. 4/5.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1827801"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1827801#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1811416" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1803315" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Xxjillrocksxx"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1702752"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Xxjillrocksxx" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1803315ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1803315" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88); The dry down smells like a mix of Ild Spice deodorant and light body odor.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1803315"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1803315#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1799754" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1799754" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="xildelphi"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1651431"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1651431.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="xildelphi" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1799754ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1799754" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1651431">xildelphi</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-03">04/03/23 18:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm getting wet, even a little musky, grassy earth from this. Kinda smells like someone who just emerged from the bush after a downpour. I adore this kind of petrichor scent, but my issue is just figuring out when I'd want to smell like this. It's a distant kind of scent, and certainly not one I'd want to wear in winter or even the colder days of autumnand that's stopped me from pulling the trigger just yet.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1799754"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1799754#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1793950" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1793950" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Eau de lys"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1576537"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Eau de lys" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Clean/Radiant-Nectar-59860.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.59860.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Radiant Nectar"title="Radiant Nectar"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1793950ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1793950" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1576537">Eau de lys</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-27">03/27/23 11:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>So far, Im quite a fan of this. The dry down intermittently smells like dirt thats been rained on and unlit charcoal incensespecifically, P.F. Candles Los Angeles incense sticks, if anyones familiar (LA is brighter smelling). Very atmospheric. Perfect for a humid, spring day with rain coming on the wind.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1793950"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1793950#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1793041" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1793041" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Gigi27"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/832464"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Gigi27" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Serge-Lutens/Fille-en-Aiguilles-6619.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6619.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fille en Aiguilles"title="Fille en Aiguilles"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1793041ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1793041" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/832464">Gigi27</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-26">03/26/23 08:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Beautiful soft patchouli. It smells nothing like petrichor, but is laden with neither amber nor fruit, nor does it go the head shop way. It smells cozy and natural, like a truly delicious skin scent. <br />
<br />
I adore it, but won't commit to a bottle for two reasons: (1) Every time I wear a sample my partner, without getting too close or knowing I am wearing scent, complaints about a mildew smell in the room. I don't get it at all, but there's that. (2)  Longevity on the skin is mediocre (smells divine on clothes the next day). To me, high end luxury is an all-around concept. Things have to be well crafted from every angle, longevity included in the case of perfume. The mediocre performance makes this a rather overpriced item to me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1793041"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1793041#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1792592" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Huge disappointment.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1744233"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1744233#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1730334" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1730334" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Shui-Xian"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1541621"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1541621.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Shui-Xian" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Versatile-Paris/Accrodisiaque-78636.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.78636.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Accrodisiaque"title="Accrodisiaque"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1730334ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1730334" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1541621">Shui-Xian</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-10">01/10/23 10:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Enjoyable patchouli, much more earthy than woody. Sweet and dark, with a fresh hint of juniper. <br />
The scent is very dry, nobly. Green notes are gentle but gives autentical vibes. Quite linear but there is convincing minimalism with this perfume.<br />
<br />
My complain is, that there are notes which I smell on paper but on my skin are almost undetactable. I am not satisfied with the projection. Longevity however about 8 hours and more.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1730334"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1730334#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1718313" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1718313" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="eaudemale"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1191172"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1191172.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="eaudemale" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Meteore-62251.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.62251.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Mtore"title="Mtore"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1718313ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1718313" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1191172">eaudemale</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-12-27">12/27/22 08:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Bought this when it was just released. I love it and been using it for years, my bottle is finished and won't be repurchasing because the longevity is extremely poor, even after all these years it didn't macerate, change or get any stronger. Maybe I got less extract than usual because I bought it at a store? Who knows I was planning  to refill it at the beginning but not anymore.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1718313"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1718313#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1707131" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1707131" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="violeteme"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1387189"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1387189.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="violeteme" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Sisley/Sisley-Eau-de-3-5852.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.5852.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sisley Eau de 3"title="Sisley Eau de 3"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1707131ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1707131" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1387189">violeteme</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-12-11">12/11/22 13:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very soft patchouli, no harshness, some woodiness. Smells similar to Velvet Haze by Byredo or along the lines of Narciso for her EDT, that type of patchouli, just less sweet than Velvet Haze and less musky than the Narciso, more woody and dry than both. Very unisex, very calming, minimal and relaxing.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1707131"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1707131#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1704853" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1704853" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="hunter.strawberry"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1251529"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1251529.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="hunter.strawberry" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1704853ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1704853" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1251529">hunter.strawberry</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-12-08">12/08/22 11:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Baie 19 <br />
<br />
This is actually pretty killer. Damp, earthy, wet soil - like note of Petrichor combined with Juniper Berry works like a dream.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1704853"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1704853#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1704081" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1704081" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="McG1993"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/477821"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.477821.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="McG1993" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1704081ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1704081" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/477821">McG1993</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-12-07">12/07/22 09:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Fresh, juicy pear and brand new carpet are immediately what came to mind when smelling Baie 19 for the first time. It's a very quirky fragrance that I find to be strange, amusing and comforting all at the same time. It's very airy and clean, almost in a shampoo-like sort of way. With this also comes a fuzziness that I would liken to tonic water of club soda (perhaps this could be attributed to the musk and ambroxan?). Very interesting and definitely worth a look if you want something clean, inoffensive and unique.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1704081"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1704081#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1702964" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1670671" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="tropicalfruit42"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1291082"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1291082.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="tropicalfruit42" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1670671ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1670671" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1291082">tropicalfruit42</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-10-20">10/20/22 20:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>the patchouli in this is airy compared to patchouli 24. i like the idea of this being a petrichor smell. to me it does a good job of capturing the essence in a wearable way. if it were just straight up petrichor im not sure it would be as flattering. the musk is a great foundation.<br />
<br />
my favorite occasions for wearing this are the hazy/misty days on the west coast. chesterman beach on vancouver island. wearing it as an attempt to blend in to the weather. think of a parking lot at the entrance of a tall forest on a grey day with a drizzle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1659031" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jlee1587"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1446026"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="jlee1587" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1659031ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1659031" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1446026">jlee1587</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-10-04">10/04/22 15:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Like a dry gin fizz on a slightly damp patio.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1659031"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1659031#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1658823" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1658823" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="RMPingo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1575393"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="RMPingo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1658823ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1658823" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1575393">RMPingo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-10-04">10/04/22 10:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Too sweet.  Ironically enough, I bought this because I wanted the ozonic/metallic/factory full of chemicals scent. On my wrist, this perfume delivers none of that. It's sugary and not ozonic at all, definitely nothing close to petrichor. It's delightful, but certainly not as advertised.  Oh well.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1658823"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1658823#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1656535" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1656535" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cheonzae"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1438186"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1438186.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="cheonzae" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1656535ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1656535" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1438186">cheonzae</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-09-30">09/30/22 23:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I like almost any perfume with patchouli in it. And I love almost all the perfumes of Le Labo. But this is... too ozonic, too metallic, and it smells like a factory full of chemicals.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1656535"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1656535#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1646914" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1646914" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jacquavit"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1548043"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="jacquavit" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Cristalle-Eau-Verte-5909.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.5909.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Cristalle Eau Verte"title="Cristalle Eau Verte"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1646914ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1646914" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1548043">jacquavit</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-09-17">09/17/22 03:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I feel like I've stepped off of a musty, long, tedious bus ride to nowhere and I'm having my first breath of fresh mossy air when I smell this fragrance. I love it, but it's special and hard to pinpoint exactly whats making it so special.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1646914"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1646914#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1626643" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1626643" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="raw.beast"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1516279"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1516279.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="raw.beast" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Franck-Boclet/Crime-49358.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.49358.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Crime"title="Crime"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1626643ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1626643" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1516279">raw.beast</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-08-18">08/18/22 22:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>One of my fav Le Labo frags, Baie 19 is a light unisex piece of art. That small artwork you find in a south tourist town in a small private artists shop. Most of Le Labo frags are such tiny windows to another realities. <br />
<br />
Vetiver isnt listed in notes, but its a true dry and light vetiver. Not wet or juicy, the best word to describe this frag is - dry. It blends with juniper berries perfectly, on my taste. It sounds TASTY <br />
Patchouli here is like when you rub its leaves with your fingers - juicy, but - again - a dry kind of flavour. <br />
Ambergris is one of my personally faved notes for all times. Yes, its sweet and light, but in masculine animalic way. In Baie 19 you can smell it through the Ambroxan and its more ozonic and ethereal. <br />
<br />
The whole impression for me from this frag is like a scene in the moment when you stand in a luxury cottage-y district of a city, watching the parting thunder and smelling drying water drops from dusty tile lane and some stinging bushes (this feeling comes from patchouli + juniper berries mix). <br />
<br />
The only negative trait Ive found in this frag is its longevity. Unfortunately, it doesnt last very long. But according to its price its not a big problem, I guess.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1626643"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1626643#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1622217" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
