Pretty neat, would make for a cool candle, but not something I'd wear personally. Recommend.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1449849"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1449849#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1449201" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1449201" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Shasta Dawn"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1275398"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1275398.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Shasta Dawn" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1449201ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1449201" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1275398">Shasta Dawn</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-11-20">11/20/21 07:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Im fascinated with this fragrance. On my skin it smells just like a thunderstorm on a spring night. Theres dark wet earth, rich green vegetation, ozone and the most incredible petrichor. This is so clean and interesting and unique. Im falling in love with it. I would adore smelling this on my partner. There is something natural and sexy about It all at once. You really need to try it if youre interested in unique freshies.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1449201"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1449201#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1444063" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1444063" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="bergamotted"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1328799"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1328799.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="bergamotted" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1444063ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1444063" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1328799">bergamotted</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-11-11">11/11/21 11:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells like if it were raining in a surgery room. <br />
<br />
Opened very cold, medicinal, and surgical. Synthetic and plasticky - not at all like the beautiful petrichor I smelled when I tested this on paper. In fact, I really did love this on paper. It also has a camphorous quality that attacks your nose - very sharp and tingly, which wafts in and out.<br />
<br />
Projects quite a lot which is nice if you like it, but I don't. Dries down into a musty men's cologne kind of smell paired with burnt rubber.<br />
<br />
For realistic petrichor, Demeter Thunderstorm does a much better job at a much more affordable price.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1444063"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1444063#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1443911" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1443911" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="dottyfluff"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1410154"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="dottyfluff" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1443911ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1443911" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1410154">dottyfluff</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-11-11">11/11/21 05:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have sprayed this scent for the first time in today and I am in love. However, it is nothing like the description! The strongest note I get is resin. <br />
<br />
That is lucky for me, because it is one of my favourite scents, but I can see how it would be a bit too harsh for some people. In fact it smells like the inside of an art studio to me, one where someone, sometimes paints with oils which has a bit of an industrial feel to it. It is quite a modern, clean scent, that comes through ozonic and dry like good quality paper. <br />
<br />
There is a hint of a little bit of woody sweetness, and leather, and maybe a bit of a gently sweet aquatic note, but it is more like a memory of one.<br />
<br />
 The resin/ozonic note comes thorugh quite "high", and I don't perceive it as being very natural, but at the same time it is not offensively artifical  to me like quite a lot of Byredo scents are. The rest of it  feels quite natural. To me it smells curious/ new, like something that have never smelled before, but at the same time it reminds me of quite familiar spaces. It is quite characterful though, so  not for everyone.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1443911"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1443911#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1435192" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1435192" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="E.H.Tersono"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1252545"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1252545.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="E.H.Tersono" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1435192ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1435192" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1252545">E.H.Tersono</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-10-26">10/26/21 17:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Like all Le Labo, this has a powerful complex opening that tells a whole story in fragrance - it's fascinating how it's composed and it paints with fragrance. And then it smells like a plastic toy doll in a box that you've just opened. Synthetic, rubbery, like a Barbie or Pony toy, or a rubber eraser shaped like a strawberry. In the back is a "rain" accord often used in "clean" scents that are actually heavy and wet, like Demeter's Linen, or Clean Reserve's Fresh Linen. I don't like it and wouldn't wear it because it's too obvious and uninteresting. Comme des Garons Odeur 53 does the synthetic plastic rubber flash better. The "rain" scent in it isn't anything like what petrichor or rain actually smells like, but is the sad stand-in often used in low budget scents.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1435192"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1435192#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1433029" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1433029" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="eileenhawk"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1337579"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1337579.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="eileenhawk" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/The-Noir-29-31872.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31872.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Noir 29"title="The Noir 29"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1433029ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1433029" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1337579">eileenhawk</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-10-23">10/23/21 03:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I don't hate anything by Le Labo but this. Don't want to sugarcoat it and will just say that it's bad. Was really intrigued by it, perhaps because of my love of petrichor but this one really let me down... My flatmate liked it so I suppose it is really something you either hate or love, like Byredo's Mixed Emotions. Doesn't remind me of rain or anything really, feels kind of synthetic. Genuinely can't make myself try it again so I can write all the notes and impressions I get from it. Wore it for a day to work and felt nauseated every time I had to raise my wrist and smell it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1433029"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1433029#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1429564" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1429564" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cho-ku-rei"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1268397"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1268397.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="cho-ku-rei" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Hermes/Barenia-96428.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.96428.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Barnia"title="Barnia"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1429564ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1429564" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1268397">cho-ku-rei</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-10-17">10/17/21 03:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Initial application: herbalicious! Archetypal apothecary vibes; intensely aromatic and green. <br />
<br />
Sweetens during drydown, after about half an hour, while retaining the above. I think the combination of musk, amber and patchouli also results in a subtle leather note on my skin. <br />
<br />
Excellent longevity, lasts easily an entire day. Sillage is moderate, stronger for the first couple of hours. <br />
<br />
I like this very much. I don't always enjoy patchouli, but here it works for me, being in complete harmony with the synergy of the whole. A very wearable fragrance, while still being interesting and not at all generic. It also has a rather grounding vibe. Would certainly consider purchasing a full bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1429564"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1429564#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1428066" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; camphorous and almost minty. it's a super nostalgic smell for me so honestly it's quite comforting, but i'm sure to some it could lean a little cold/sharp!!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; Then it settles to a patchouli and rose fragrance <br />
Much like others I smelled before <br />
Longevity is average <br />
Its a very good creation by le labo<br />
But buying a full bottle is not advisable since its a close to a lot of other patchouli fragrances</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1415639"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1415639#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1409105" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1409105" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="BMac99"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1136018"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="BMac99" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/The-Noir-29-31872.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31872.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Noir 29"title="The Noir 29"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1409105ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1409105" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79); I honestly cant get enough. Light Patchouli and green earthiness radiate off of my pulse points. On me its natural but very pretty.  I receive compliments almost daily. Randoms and friends alike tell me I smell really good.  Its both feminine and enticing. Im really enamored by Baie19, it works for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1409105"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1409105#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1405936" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1405936" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Kloppo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1258241"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Kloppo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1405936ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1405936" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1258241">Kloppo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-09-07">09/07/21 07:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This one smells great. Reminds me of the smell of playing soccer in the rain with all the grass and dirt involved. Super fresh and inoffensive and I can see myself reaching for this in high heat, and most people wont even ask if youre wearing it since it smells so natural.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1405936"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1405936#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1403449" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1403449" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="plainaccount"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1301341"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="plainaccount" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1403449ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1403449" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1301341">plainaccount</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-09-02">09/02/21 19:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This smells synthetic yet natural. Reviews that claim this can be pulled off by the right person might be a bit misconstrued. You either like it and wear it or you don't. The drydown is suprisingly boring - like a mens freshie cologne.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1403449"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1403449#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1396117" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1396117" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="netosan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1377279"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1377279.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="netosan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1396117ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1396117" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1377279">netosan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-08-20">08/20/21 20:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Ive always liked patchouli by itself. But I cant stand the way it has been used in fragrances : smoky, incense, church like. On Baie 19 the patchouli is fresh , it reminds me of what Madonnas Like A Prayer smelled like. Add a heavy dose of petricorch and some really sweet note I cant detect, and you get a really unique fragrance. This one changes every hour. And when you think you dont smell it , everyone else arounds you does. If you get bored, layer it with a light touch of Rose 31, youre gonna love it!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1396117"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1396117#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1390986" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1390986" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="eliblui"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1311383"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1311383.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="eliblui" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jo-Malone-London/Wood-Sage-Sea-Salt-25529.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.25529.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Wood Sage & Sea Salt"title="Wood Sage & Sea Salt"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1390986ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1390986" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1311383">eliblui</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-08-12">08/12/21 03:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I will try to put it as politely as possible..<br />
<br />
...on my skin, it smelled like an ashtray that was left outside on the balcony fully exposed to the harsh afternoon sun. And then somebody came along and clouded the ashtray with an ozonic-patchouli concoction to help cover up the odour. As a side note - I live in a non-smoking household. I wonder if it is the woodsy notes?<br />
<br />
As you can tell, it really didn't work for me and doesn't quite appeal to my olfactory preferences.<br />
<br />
However!<br />
<br />
It is quite charismatic. I don't believe Baie 19 - like many other daring niche fragrances - are meant to appeal to everyone and I don't believe that absolutely everyone can pull it off either. On the right person, oh boy, it is probably going to be a showstopper. Someone bold, daring, rough around the edges and confident, with a preference for black clothes, dark beers and adventures. <br />
<br />
Sure, women can wear it too if they wish so, but -for me!-  if this perfume was a real life person, it would be a tall, charismatic guy with an unruly full beard and the warmest smile that contrasts his intimidating stature.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1390986"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1390986#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1387786" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1387786" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mohsen95"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/995817"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.995817.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mohsen95" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1387786ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1387786" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/995817">mohsen95</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-08-06">08/06/21 11:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>5/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1387786"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1387786#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1387176" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1387176" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="pandora0646"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1369987"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1369987.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="pandora0646" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Serge-Lutens/Santal-Majuscule-15547.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.15547.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Santal Majuscule"title="Santal Majuscule"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1387176ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1387176" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1369987">pandora0646</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-08-05">08/05/21 10:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This smells like the synthetic version of fresh rain on newly cut grass. There are times when it unfolds into a completely earthy, beautiful composition with minimal synthetic undertones, but after testing it I think this only happens when worn in summer months. I initially smelled it on a close acquaintance and had to grab a sample since it smelled so good on her. I'm reserving this for hot summer months when I'm feeling fresh and earthy.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1387176"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1387176#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1387073" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1387073" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="chrisk252"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1185528"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="chrisk252" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Cerruti/1881-Men-329.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.329.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="1881 Men"title="1881 Men"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1387073ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1387073" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1185528">chrisk252</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-08-05">08/05/21 07:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Warm, cozy, musky, patchouli, woody frag with a hint of leather for cool fall or winter days by a fireplace reading old dusty books.<br />
Scent: 7.5<br />
Sillage: 7.5<br />
Longevity: 8</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1387073"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1387073#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1382062" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1382062" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Imogenr17"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1362769"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1362769.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Imogenr17" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lancome/La-Vie-Est-Belle-Iris-Absolu-79245.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.79245.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="La Vie Est Belle Iris Absolu"title="La Vie Est Belle Iris Absolu"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1382062ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1382062" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1362769">Imogenr17</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-07-26">07/26/21 23:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I received a sample of this today with an online order. I was hoping for a sample of another fragrance, however when I saw Id received Baie 19 I was pleasantly surprised. Ive been researching a lot of perfumes lately due to lockdown boredom and this scent had been on my mind as something I thought was cool and hoped I could pull off. <br />
<br />
The tiny vial didnt come with an atomizer, so I was only able to dab a small amount onto my wrist. My oh my, am I surprised. Speechless, even. This scent is powerful even in small doses. From the first sniff, I loved it. Im assuming I detected a strong whiff of juniper berry, however Im unsure what the exact notes were. I adore perfume, but Im yet to learn the individual scents by name. But putting this scent into words is even difficult. From reading through other reviews, I agree with a lot of what Ive read. Petrichor is likely a perfect description of this scent, which I have to admit my former tumblr addict self is excited about. It feels cold, bold, but enticing. I envisage the modern day ice queen that appears flawless and impossible to penetrate unless she allows you into her secret circle. The kind of woman that many men fantasise about, wishing they could claim her. Ironically this is also the kind of woman that I am completely opposite from, yet somehow still have a desire to be like at times. I feel like this is the kind of scent to wear when you want to be left alone. A kind of loud announcement making yourself impossible to be unnoticed, yet with a strong message of dont bother me. It definitely feels powerful to me. Yet on the other hand, the petrichor resemblance leaves me with a totally different vibe. Yes it is cold, but not emotionally so, at least not deliberately. Perhaps its the scent of being alone, but being quite content with it.<br />
<br />
This is the imagery I get, after having it on me for 30-45 minutes:<br />
<br />
Its raining, but you decide you want to be alone with the woods and so you head out without an umbrella, somewhat brooding. Youre the one who left their home city, bustling with people and sunshine, to move across the world. The dreary town you now call home rains more than it shines, which is evident by the lush green foliage peeping across your bay window. People tend to keep to themselves, which suits you just fine. You want to become this person, alone with yourself, delving deep into the waters of your own soul so you can create life-altering art. You expose yourself to the elements so you can really feel. You stay on walking through the wet grass, slippery twigs and dripping trees until youre so cold you can only just feel your toes. You then return home to create, full to the brim with emotion from just experiencing life. <br />
<br />
Its safe to say, I now have to have this fragrance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1382062"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1382062#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1377957" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1377957" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Punkrockbebop"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1170096"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1170096.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Punkrockbebop" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Alkemia-Perfumes/Falling-Stars-on-Winter-Solstice-54086.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.54086.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Falling Stars on Winter Solstice"title="Falling Stars on Winter Solstice"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1377957ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1377957" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1170096">Punkrockbebop</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-07-18">07/18/21 14:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The SA says, Its supposed to smell like after a rain.  Instead it smells like a perfumers composition gone unfinished, resulting in a simplistic, very chemically potent accord that has no balancing ingredients in it to curtail its uncontrolled projection and longevity. It smells of calone and synthetic patchouli. Truly one of the more vile things Ive smelled, and I am a fan of challenging scents that are actual, well thought out compositions, like the original Zoologist Bat or Figment Man.  Big Pass.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1377957"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1377957#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1374907" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1374907" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Hawaii Jake"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1359265"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1359265.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Hawaii Jake" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1374907ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1374907" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1359265">Hawaii Jake</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-07-12">07/12/21 18:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>On my skin, this smells like a very lovely rain. On dry down, it smells like Ivory soap with patchouli added. On the right skin, I'm sure it's lovely.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1374907"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1374907#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1370981" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1370981" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Akscent"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1322642"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1322642.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Akscent" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.57513.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Baie 19"title="Baie 19"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1370981ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1370981" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1322642">Akscent</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-07-05">07/05/21 09:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>My life is awash with examples of snap judgments turning out wrong with more information or exposure to a subject.  Baie 19 is an example of a fragrance where my initial impression and the conclusion I drew based on limited exposure was wrong.<br />
<br />
This scent is structured around the odd ozonic note of petrichor, the heady, earthy smell of ground after a rain.  The novelty of using petrichor in fragrance was something of a minor trend in 2019-2020.  Fragrances like this one, Petrichor Plains from Mihan Aromatics and My Most Meaningful Relationships by Filigree &amp; Shadow, are all examples.  But whereas the latter two scents focus on a fairly linear presentation of petrichor with rosewood, Baie 19 presents a more variegated composition with a green, slightly medicinal patchouli weaving its way in and around the pertichor.  There is also a sharp, medicinal green herbal note and some cool, bitter juniper in the mix here.<br />
<br />
This is a surprisingly sharp, occasionally camphorous and oddly watery experience with ambroxan boosted longevity and even a bit of musky, ambrette seed like, animalic tones later in the progression to lend an unexpected note to the base.  All-in-all, Baie 19 is a blend of smells that is at once familiar and yet novel.  And it is polarizing.  Many folks will dislike it and the first time I smelled it, I found it off-putting.  Later, I found myself drawn to the spot where I had tested it on skin.  The attraction was persistent and it grew stronger.  Eventually, I bought a large bottle and have come to really love this unusual fragrance.<br />
<br />
If you get a chance, sample it over time, on skin, with a willingness to forgive what may initially strike you as a scent you dislike.  Over time, with repeated sniffs and some reflection, the beauty in the totality of this moderately projecting, unique patchouli fragrance may just win your olfactory heart as it has mine.  Oftentimes the most rewarding things start off as difficult and the experience of Baie 19 is one of those things.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1370981"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1370981#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1333782" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1333782" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="NDStars"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1259949"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1259949.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="NDStars" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1333782ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1333782" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1259949">NDStars</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-04-28">04/28/21 09:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>First blast of sweet fruity velvety patchouli and woods, like you're going for an autumn walk through a leafy forest. It's not invigorating like pine, it's just moist and green. After a minute, a medicinal mentholated/eucalyptus note starts to project and the berry fruit starts to take on an overripe almost rotten nuance. The opening of this one was much better than what it is now. This is straight up one of those ointments you use on sore joints. Yeesh! Projection is rather strong too because of course it is. Unisex but leans male, as in in old grandpa who loves Aqua Velva. Best suited for autumn weather.<br />
<br />
6+ hours later: The scent stayed linear on the medicinal note but at least it died down to a faint whiff.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1333782"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1333782#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1331833" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1331833" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Pjrnyc87"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1330356"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Pjrnyc87" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1331833ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1331833" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1330356">Pjrnyc87</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-04-24">04/24/21 22:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Immediately when I sprayed this onto my skin, I thought: finally something not everyone is going to love. Living in the West Village, actually I live above Le Labo, everyone and their child smells like Santal 33. I can see why people love this or it might be too strong if theyre used to the Another 13s or Jasmin... ten seconds after I applied it, I was transported back ten years and I couldnt remember what it smelt like. It wasnt until hours later (yes it lasts that long, and someone even asked what I was wearing) until it clicked: 2007, living in Hells Kitchen, it was Ice*Men by Mugler. Oh, I was so happy. I finally got to smell this again. But my does it last way longer and just an overall better version of it. I wonder if they have any idea how similar, if not identical to me, these two are. I love this so much and I indeed walked out of Le Labo with a bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1331833"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1331833#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1331650" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1331650" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Glyph"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1312716"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1312716.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Glyph" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Serge-Lutens/Santal-Majuscule-15547.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.15547.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Santal Majuscule"title="Santal Majuscule"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1331650ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1331650" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1312716">Glyph</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-04-24">04/24/21 15:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The lovely, heady smell of petrichor--that incredibly oxygenated earthy smell released after a good rain--is frequently evident in the Pacific Northwest, where I live; and this fragrance does a better job evoking it than I would have dreamed possible. To me this is just heaven, and to many other people who absolutely love this invigorating smell I suspect it will also be the same.<br />
<br />
This being said, the reviews below are proof that this fragrance is to the nose what cilantro or coconut are to taste-buds: you're either going to love it or you'll hate it. Because of this, a blind-buy would be an insane choice, especially given how expensive this is: it seems this consistently smells to some people as much like a leaky ancient chemistry set as it does to others like a leafy residential street in Seattle after an April downpour. It also seems like this might be something you'd want to test out with your partner and your co-workers before purchasing since some people react so wildly against it.<br />
<br />
In any case: this stands as one of my most remarkable fragrance discoveries so far.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1331650"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1331650#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1325255" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1325255" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Sandy156"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1324065"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1324065.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Sandy156" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1325255ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1325255" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1324065">Sandy156</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-04-14">04/14/21 07:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Wow, this does smell like petrichor. I need to keep testing this. The drydown gave me a headache but I loved the minty juniper opening. Not a safe blind buy (I blind bought this cause there were no samples available where I live).</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1325255"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1325255#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1322897" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1322897" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lovetribe"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/501028"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.501028.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lovetribe" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1322897ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1322897" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/501028">lovetribe</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-04-10">04/10/21 07:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>the sanitary smell of freshly cleaned cleaning with alcohol.<br />
damp, moldy. didn't smell like rain. the recycling bin for organic waste or a rancid oil.<br />
the worst perfume ever smelled.<br />
<br />
vote 0/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1322897"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1322897#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1314523" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1314523" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="17seyed"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1165604"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1165604.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="17seyed" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1314523ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1314523" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1165604">17seyed</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-03-26">03/26/21 13:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Nowhere near the caliber of other Le Labo staples. Baie 19 smells like the residual scent of an essential oil, almost feels like an incomplete fragrance. You get heavy calone in the opening, then a green and musky patchouli in the heart that dries down to nothingness, and I don't mean that as a compliment for minimalism. You can barely pick up any notes other than a faint patchouli after 30 minutes. <br />
<br />
I don't get any "rainy" emotions from this. Rain to me is purifying, lively, meditative, and romantic. Baie 19 induces neither of those feelings. It smells herbal, medicinal, and annoyingly synthetic. <br />
<br />
If you enjoy this type of composition but want something more potent, I recommend seeking out a bottle of Blasted Heath by Penhaligons.<br />
<br />
I have heard from credible sources that Le Labo's next classic line release will be centered around Cedarwood. Let's hope that's a return to form for them since I've always thoroughly enjoyed their woody scents. As far as Baie 19 is concerned, there is only one B19 king in Le Labo's lineup and his name is Benjoin 19.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1314523"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1314523#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1304951" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1304951" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="moderndandy_swap"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1289040"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1289040.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="moderndandy_swap" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1304951ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1304951" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1289040">moderndandy_swap</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-03-09">03/09/21 11:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Amouage Figment Man with blackcurrant/fruity/berry notes. Very unusal, I like it. BUT, later in a drydown, abroxan started to rear its ugly head, and the whole composition started to get nasty messy turns, and it started to smell like a cheap car fragrance (including heated plastic smell).</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1304951"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1304951#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1296846" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1296846" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Recklessssssss"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1308314"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1308314.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Recklessssssss" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1296846ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1296846" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1308314">Recklessssssss</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-02-22">02/22/21 09:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love this. It's rainy, wet, clear.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1296846"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1296846#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1293830" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
