Damp earth, rain.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1159840"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1159840#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1145692" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1145692" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="chinook"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/293892"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.293892.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="chinook" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1145692ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1145692" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/293892">chinook</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-02-15">02/15/20 16:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Baie 19 reminds me of an older man in a wool blazer. Its bitter green, leafy, herbal. It doesnt have any artificial sharpness to it. Its aloof but familiar, clean but not sterile. Masculine but could be very chic on a woman. Great for people who enjoy woody green scents. Moderate sillage and half a day longevity.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1145692"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1145692#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1145487" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1145487" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="kishka"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/254635"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.254635.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="kishka" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Ombre-Nomade-49755.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.49755.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Ombre Nomade"title="Ombre Nomade"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1145487ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1145487" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/254635">kishka</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-02-15">02/15/20 07:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Id love this on a guy....I think its well done, smart, very different and really sexy.....but not on me.  It does smell like fresh rain on hot concrete, also a refined herbal ambroxan which le Labo do particularly well.  My favourite for summer is still Bergamot and for winter I alternate between Tonka and Santal. I just love this house ... I dont care what they call their perfumes, theyre not cheap but you can get small bottles, or body products, perfume oils....Fabulous!!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1145487"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1145487#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1139960" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1139960" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="hullhockey91"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/290776"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="hullhockey91" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Aventus-9828.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.9828.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Aventus"title="Aventus"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1139960ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1139960" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/290776">hullhockey91</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-01-30">01/30/20 21:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This one paints a picture for me. My wife and I just had a house built in a new community. We are currently the 2nd house on our 8-house block. The builders are in the process of building three more as we speak. <br />
<br />
The reason I bring that up is because I am really distinguishing the similarity between the smell of the fragrance to what I smell and see every day. <br />
<br />
Upon first blast, its portrays a real cloudy day with the sun trying so hard to peak through. Lots of front end loaders moving earth. Huge mounds of dirt surrounding the foundations of the new homes. A nice, calm day. No breeze, nothing. Just a grey sky, large piles of earth/soil/dirt and the smell of fresh, dirty air (if that makes sense). <br />
<br />
As it settles, the sun is now peaking through giving some well needed life and spirit. I still see large mounds of earth, a partly-cloudy sky and some pine trees in the front yards of the new homes. <br />
<br />
It's so crazily interesting to me. I absolutely love when fragrances have the artistic attributes to paint pictures. Le Labo continues to amaze me. <br />
<br />
For anyone that cannot imagine what I am living through at the moment......<br />
Imagine this....Imagine standing next to a huge pile of freshly moved earth. The skies are partly cloudy, the weather is 70 degrees and there are some pine trees surrounding you. Take a huge deep breath, and just imagine the air is crisp and pure mixed with the earth and trees. Straight up modern nature. Now you have smelled this fragrance! <br />
<br />
That is the best I can give you at this point. <br />
<br />
Now onto the scent.....<br />
<br />
This is a patchouli BOMB! The dry, earthy, peppery patchouli. Today as I wore it, I got a slight sniff of the "ozonic notes" and it made me smile. I am not sure I get much more than the patchouli as of now, but I can tell you there is more going on. <br />
<br />
This is absolutely not for everyone. At times I feel like its "old-mannish," but then on the other hand, I am completely happy I actually found my perfect patchouli fragrance! <br />
<br />
It is insanely intriguing because I feel like it smells weird, but then again, this kind of weird is excellent. I love it because I can associate with it. Time will tell if it works for me or not, but as of now, I am happy I bought this!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1139960"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1139960#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1139128" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1139128" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Mzsuperstar"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1213503"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Mzsuperstar" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1139128ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1139128" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1213503">Mzsuperstar</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-01-28">01/28/20 14:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Dear god, the sample vial leaked onto my hand as I was trying to open it, and what I got from that small amount was diesel fumes and something peppery and vaguely green. I hadnt researched the notes at all in advance, but with the petrichor note, I basically get an image of a rain-drenched truck stop parking lot. It was one of the only immediate scrubbers I have ever experienced. It may take me a while to work up the guts to sample this again and see what the dry down has to offer. I am fairly certain, however, that rain-soaked earth is not what I want to smell like.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1139128"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1139128#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="57513" sentiment="all"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-positive-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Positive Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent1259222" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1259222" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Notycd"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/594786"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.594786.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Notycd" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1259222ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1259222" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/594786">Notycd</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-12-10">12/10/20 09:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Like Le Labo says: nothing smells like it. I fully agree, but I will try to put it into words. Baie 19 smells like returning from a long walk. You know, "you smell like outside". That. <br />
<br />
It's clean and abstract but has this earthy cast to it. Although it does evoke a feeling, it's pretty cold and apathic. No warming or uplifting notes here, but that's what makes this so good. <br />
<br />
As with most Le Labo fragrances, this is 100% linear. It also lasts for weeks on clothing. Sillage is good, perfect for this kind of scent. Think of it as a grown up version of Santal 33. Santal 33 is like a Gucci belt and Balenciaga sneakers. Baie 19 is a The Row jacket. <br />
<br />
Now, this is not for an inexperienced nose. Reviews here are very mixed. You won't like this if you're unfamiliar with these more 'raw' fragraces. That being said, this does smell great on someone else. (And would be irresistible on that sweatshirt you stole from your lover.)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1259222"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1259222#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1382062" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1382062" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Imogenr17"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1362769"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1362769.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Imogenr17" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lancome/La-Vie-Est-Belle-Iris-Absolu-79245.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.79245.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="La Vie Est Belle Iris Absolu"title="La Vie Est Belle Iris Absolu"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1382062ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1382062" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1362769">Imogenr17</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-07-26">07/26/21 23:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I received a sample of this today with an online order. I was hoping for a sample of another fragrance, however when I saw Id received Baie 19 I was pleasantly surprised. Ive been researching a lot of perfumes lately due to lockdown boredom and this scent had been on my mind as something I thought was cool and hoped I could pull off. <br />
<br />
The tiny vial didnt come with an atomizer, so I was only able to dab a small amount onto my wrist. My oh my, am I surprised. Speechless, even. This scent is powerful even in small doses. From the first sniff, I loved it. Im assuming I detected a strong whiff of juniper berry, however Im unsure what the exact notes were. I adore perfume, but Im yet to learn the individual scents by name. But putting this scent into words is even difficult. From reading through other reviews, I agree with a lot of what Ive read. Petrichor is likely a perfect description of this scent, which I have to admit my former tumblr addict self is excited about. It feels cold, bold, but enticing. I envisage the modern day ice queen that appears flawless and impossible to penetrate unless she allows you into her secret circle. The kind of woman that many men fantasise about, wishing they could claim her. Ironically this is also the kind of woman that I am completely opposite from, yet somehow still have a desire to be like at times. I feel like this is the kind of scent to wear when you want to be left alone. A kind of loud announcement making yourself impossible to be unnoticed, yet with a strong message of dont bother me. It definitely feels powerful to me. Yet on the other hand, the petrichor resemblance leaves me with a totally different vibe. Yes it is cold, but not emotionally so, at least not deliberately. Perhaps its the scent of being alone, but being quite content with it.<br />
<br />
This is the imagery I get, after having it on me for 30-45 minutes:<br />
<br />
Its raining, but you decide you want to be alone with the woods and so you head out without an umbrella, somewhat brooding. Youre the one who left their home city, bustling with people and sunshine, to move across the world. The dreary town you now call home rains more than it shines, which is evident by the lush green foliage peeping across your bay window. People tend to keep to themselves, which suits you just fine. You want to become this person, alone with yourself, delving deep into the waters of your own soul so you can create life-altering art. You expose yourself to the elements so you can really feel. You stay on walking through the wet grass, slippery twigs and dripping trees until youre so cold you can only just feel your toes. You then return home to create, full to the brim with emotion from just experiencing life. <br />
<br />
Its safe to say, I now have to have this fragrance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1382062"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1382062#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1107160" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1107160" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Vincethedevil"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/358820"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Vincethedevil" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1107160ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1107160" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/358820">Vincethedevil</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-10-16">10/16/19 21:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Bought this one in Paris the week of the launch and to be honest it's a pretty solid release from Le Labo. What I get from it is the obvious juniper berry note supported by a methol feel which keeps it fresh. The scent also has a very light sweetness to it which makes me think about the sweeter kind of berry without smelling like them. This scent is truly unisex, versatile and has very good longevity. I can smell myself for 7 hours and it stays on the skin for another 2.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1107160"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1107160#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1187887" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1187887" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="oneofheralteregos"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1219595"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1219595.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="oneofheralteregos" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/Gaiac-10-Tokyo-6335.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6335.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gaiac 10 Tokyo"title="Gaiac 10 Tokyo"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1187887ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1187887" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1219595">oneofheralteregos</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-06-13">06/13/20 11:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very very very intoxicating without being anything close to cloying.<br />
The kind of fragrance that gets noticed everytime you move.<br />
Green, fresh, relaxing scent.<br />
This is exactly what they claimed to be, a petrichor.<br />
If Im not mistaken, this has similar DNA to le labo city exclusive Gaiac 10, its like gaiacs fresh charismatic older sibling.<br />
Lasts all day on my skin (i live in tropical country) with very good sillage and projection.<br />
Very versatile and office friendly too<br />
9/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1187887"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1187887#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1370981" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1370981" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Akscent"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1322642"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1322642.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Akscent" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.57513.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Baie 19"title="Baie 19"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1370981ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1370981" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1322642">Akscent</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-07-05">07/05/21 09:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>My life is awash with examples of snap judgments turning out wrong with more information or exposure to a subject.  Baie 19 is an example of a fragrance where my initial impression and the conclusion I drew based on limited exposure was wrong.<br />
<br />
This scent is structured around the odd ozonic note of petrichor, the heady, earthy smell of ground after a rain.  The novelty of using petrichor in fragrance was something of a minor trend in 2019-2020.  Fragrances like this one, Petrichor Plains from Mihan Aromatics and My Most Meaningful Relationships by Filigree &amp; Shadow, are all examples.  But whereas the latter two scents focus on a fairly linear presentation of petrichor with rosewood, Baie 19 presents a more variegated composition with a green, slightly medicinal patchouli weaving its way in and around the pertichor.  There is also a sharp, medicinal green herbal note and some cool, bitter juniper in the mix here.<br />
<br />
This is a surprisingly sharp, occasionally camphorous and oddly watery experience with ambroxan boosted longevity and even a bit of musky, ambrette seed like, animalic tones later in the progression to lend an unexpected note to the base.  All-in-all, Baie 19 is a blend of smells that is at once familiar and yet novel.  And it is polarizing.  Many folks will dislike it and the first time I smelled it, I found it off-putting.  Later, I found myself drawn to the spot where I had tested it on skin.  The attraction was persistent and it grew stronger.  Eventually, I bought a large bottle and have come to really love this unusual fragrance.<br />
<br />
If you get a chance, sample it over time, on skin, with a willingness to forgive what may initially strike you as a scent you dislike.  Over time, with repeated sniffs and some reflection, the beauty in the totality of this moderately projecting, unique patchouli fragrance may just win your olfactory heart as it has mine.  Oftentimes the most rewarding things start off as difficult and the experience of Baie 19 is one of those things.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1370981"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1370981#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="57513" sentiment="positive"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-negative-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Negative Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent1118875" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1118875" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="17seyed"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1165604"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1165604.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="17seyed" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1118875ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1118875" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1165604">17seyed</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-11-25">11/25/19 11:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells like something you'd pick up at a drugstore discount pile for $20. Yes it smells good, but at a $300 price tag, the expectation bar should be a little higher than just "it smells like a decent aquatic".<br />
<br />
Hard pass</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1118875"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1118875#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1206818" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1206818" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="RottigrlNYC"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1191473"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1191473.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="RottigrlNYC" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1206818ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1206818" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1191473">RottigrlNYC</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-08-02">08/02/20 16:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>My goodness Le Labo truly creates some very nice unique perfumes . This one is so unique . I really like it. I wont begin to describe the smell coz I cant. I just really like it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1206818"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1206818#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1137868" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1137868" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ts4r"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1143921"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1143921.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ts4r" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Escentric-Molecules/Escentric-05-58970.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.58970.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Escentric 05"title="Escentric 05"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1137868ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1137868" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1143921">ts4r</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-01-24">01/24/20 20:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>the opening smells literally like fresh rain, some effervescence, earthiness. it reminds me of (almost exactly) Straight to Heaven. the drydown is all Catelox, and Patchouli. it definitely isnt ambroxan. it has too much of a lotion vibe going on to be ambroxan.<br />
<br />
if you like abstract, airy fragrances such as Straight to Heaven, A13, Molecule 01, 02, Lorpheline, JHAG Not a Perfume, then this will will be right up your alley.<br />
its a bit expensive for what it is. Try before you buy. you may love it</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1137868"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1137868#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1128373" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1128373" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ateneo_ldb"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1068097"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1068097.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ateneo_ldb" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Gucci/The-Last-Day-Of-Summer-Eau-de-Parfum-53090.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.53090.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum"title="The Last Day Of Summer Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1128373ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1128373" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1068097">ateneo_ldb</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-12-27">12/27/19 19:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is...remarkably bad. And I'm quite a fan of Le Labo's other fragrances (Santal 33 is still my favorite, along with Th Noir 29). I was really sold on this petrichor note that a lot of people have mentioned, but there's absolutely none of that here. For the first few hours, this was just patchouli/ambroxan/sunscreen bomb in an almost vomit-inducing way. Someone said it really well below; cloying, yet barely there. In the dry down, it's a much more pleasant, though a wholly unoriginal and mostly imperceptible aldehydic musk.<br />
<br />
If you're looking for a ozonic/aquatic patchouli-ish scent, I'd say Etat Libre d'Orange's Hermann a Mes Ctes Me Parassait Une Ombre succeeds where this does not, although that dries down to a screechy ambroxan as well. There are plenty of other "petrichor" or "rain" fragrances/oils that come much, much closer to that smell than whatever this is. Any petrichor oil on Etsy will give you a much more satisfying rain smell than this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1128373"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1128373#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1257710" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1257710" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="fragrancemusing"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1274631"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="fragrancemusing" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1257710ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1257710" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1274631">fragrancemusing</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-12-07">12/07/20 02:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Not really drawn to this.. yes it smells damp, watery, like a mossy green pond on a cool evening. But it is not an inviting scent that draws people to you. I agree with most reviewers, it also has a medicinal quality to it - "wood-panelled apothecary" is a very succinct way to describe it. If i smell a stranger wearing this after a long day at work, i might think he works in a very old pharmacy preparing medicine all day long.. it's a scent that brings out very cold and unemotional feelings in me. <br />
<br />
I think these notes might work for a home or indoor fragrance. But it doesn't really work for body fragrance... not for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57513"comment_id="1257710"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Baie-19-57513.html?ccid=1257710#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="57513" sentiment="negative"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="search-reviews"><search-perfume-reviews :perfume_id="57513":random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]"></search-perfume-reviews></div></div><foundation-tabs></foundation-tabs></reviews-wrapper></div><perfume-shortcut-menu :perfume_id="57513" when-hidden="#toptop"></perfume-shortcut-menu><initialize-status-data></initialize-status-data><div class="cell small-12"><!-- Tag ID: fragranticacom_perfume_footer -->

        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">54.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 1; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/designers/Narciso-Rodriguez.html" class="en2inter">Narciso Rodriguez</a>
        </span>
    </div>
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 1.7em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">55.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 1; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/designers/Frederic-Malle.html" class="en2inter">Frederic Malle</a>
        </span>
    </div>
            </div>
        <div class="cell small-4 medium-2 flex-container flex-dir-column">
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 1.7em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">56.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 1; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/designers/Montblanc.html" class="en2inter">Montblanc</a>
        </span>
    </div>

    <script>

                if (lang == 'MN') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.mn").replace(/perfume/, "perfumes") });
                if (lang == 'HE') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.co.il").replace(/perfume/, "perfumes") });
            });
</script>


<script  data-cfasync="false">
    // Check that service workers are supported
    if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
        // Use the window load event to keep the page load performant
        window.addEventListener('load', () => {
            navigator.serviceWorker.register('/service-worker.js?v=rtgFr7c4b6b084f801d1036ebe90095780be1');
        });
    }
</script>
<script>
    $(document).ready(function () {
        $('#fragranticaloader').fadeOut(20);
    });
</script>
</body>
</html>
